divs: sighting detailsi realize this is an old and well documented event. i am a former usaf fighter pilot, and when i saw this craft, i had hundreds of flying hours, many of them at night in formation with other small and large aircraft. i have also been studying astronomy\cosmology\physics for over 20 years. i was travelling on i-84 towards hartford at about 9 pm (it was dark) when my cb radio "lit up" with a lot of chatter from the truckers, "what the hell is that?", etc. etc. i looked to my upper left and saw a huge craft with brilliant white lights (no "beams" like headlights on a car). the lights were pretty much equi-distant from eachother. it appeared to be low (maybe 1000 ft agl) and it didn't appear to be moving. i had no depth perception due to it being night, so i can't really specify distance but it was (approx.)less than a mile away. i could not see any structure, just the lights. as far as size goes, i can't really estimate due to the lack of anything to compare it to. as a pilot, what i observed gave me my first and only perception that it was an elaborate hoax by some knucklehead with a huge glider who put on several bright lights. the issue of aircraft flying in formation never even entered my head because whatever it was, it was not a formation of aircraft--it was a rigid structure. trust me on that one, it was not a formation of aircraft. if it was a bunch of ultra-lights, what were they using for their artificial horizon? anybody flying at night w\o an artificial horizon would be on a suicide mission--look what happened to jfk jr., and he had an attitude indicator. so for me, it ended with me thinking that it was an elaborate hoax. i never thought of it again until 20 years later when i read a book called "night siege" which, as you know, is about the "hudson valley ufo". the pictures in the book are what i saw that night.
